content.description:
Located on the North-east arete of the  summit block.  Climb edges up the east face and arete to your right over a bad landing.  A classic, airy outing that deserves more traffic.  There is a bolt on top.

This block may offer other committing lines for highball aficionados.

Start low in the center of the East face and make a powerfull move up to a large hueco. The hueco is fairly shallow. From here make a big move rightward to a good in cut and keep it together for a fun mantel.
content.protection: Sketchy landing. Have a good spotter and pads.
content.location: Center of the East face. This face is hidden from the view of hikers on the trail.

content.description:
Stand Start matched on a big slot rail. Grainy, but it could clean up with more traffic. Make a few pulls right traversing the slopey rail before heading up to top out.

A slightly harder variation is a direct version topping out on slopers. This line is called Sierra Phantom and has a v2 consensus.
content.location: On the boulders south face there in an obvious slot/ rail.

content.description:
Stand Start on the boulders easy face on a large knobby hold and make a dyno up and left to the end of the slopey rail system. Might be slightly painful if you haven't taken a rest day in a while. The rail is grainy and painful, better latch it first go!

Top out As for the Boneyard Rail Problem or traverse is left and finish as for Sierra Phantom for a fun variation at a grade harder.
content.protection: Crash pads, super glue and a spotter.
content.location: On the boulders east face. The leg bone feature will be uphill behind the start.

content.description:
A good problem starting on a left sidepull inside of a hueco. From here make a move rightward to slopers and then make a hard move to a side pull sloper up and right. Stay tight against the wall and keep it subtle for the topout!

This problem might not go in the summer time!
content.location: West side face of the boulder. If viewing from the slot/ rail problem, this line is left and around the bulge.
